Description: Rim sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; exterior reserved.
Curator's comments: Simple Animal Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well. For parallels regarding chalice style chalices, see Lemos no. 1131-1132 (both from Tocra).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1499) (phase 2)
